CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 5, 1960, pg. A3, reads: "Dynamite Expert - Harry Petty, experiences dynamite demolition expert, is shown as he gave a demonstration during January of last year, in Courier offices, of this U. S. Government recognized prowess in the handling of dynamite. The Courier published a feature article with a picture of Mr. Petty taking part in an examination, under Pennsylvania State auspices sot that a Uniontown man could become licensed. - Harris Photo."  Accompanying article reads: "Dynamite Found in Expert's Residence - Licensed dynamiter Harry Petty, 54, or 2029 Rose St., one of the three dynamite experts 'on call' for U. S. Government and private industry demolition in Western Pennsylvania, Ohio and West Virginia, was awaiting a Centre Ave. Police Court hearing set for Friday, on a 1957 city ordinance which prohibits the storing of explosive materials..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Harry Petty with dynamite and blasting equipment, in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper office
